Package pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic piece on the chess board.
    Author:
    Bryan Law, Ryan Kim

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public abstract boolean move​(Board boardObj,
                             int i,
                             int j)
        Moves a chess piece to the given position.
        Parameters:
        boardObj - Object refering to the chessboard.
        i - Translated x position for destination.
        j - Translated y position for destination.
        Returns:
        true if move is successful, otherwise false

      • move

        public boolean move​(Board boardObj,
                    int i,
                    int j,
                    java.lang.String s)
        Moves and promotes a pawn piece if it has reached the other side.

        This move function is only intended to be used for the pawn piece and will return false otherwise.

        Parameters:
        boardObj - Object refering to the chessboard.
        i - Translated x position for destination.
        j - Translated y position for destination.
        s - Piece to promote to.
        Returns:
        true if successful(and is pawn piece), otherwise false

      • check

        public abstract boolean check​(Board boardObj,
                              int x,
                              int y)
        Determines if the current piece puts the King piece in check.
        Parameters:
        boardObj - Object refering to the chessboard.
        x - Translated x position of the King.
        y - Translated y positions of the King.
        Returns:
        true if the King is in check, otherwise false.

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        Get method for the Piece's color.
        Returns:
        color of Piece
